Data Structures

struct  Entity_S
struct  eolEntityPointer

Typedefs

typedef struct Entity_S eolEntity
typedef void(* eolEntityCustomDelete )(void *customData)
 this is the function prototype for a customData delete function a delete function must be provided if using customData the function must take a pointer to the custom data. It should be cast internally as the customData type.

Enumerations

enum  eolEntityStates { eolEntitySpawn = 0, eolEntityActive = 1, eolEntityDying = 2, eolEntityDead = 3 }
enum  eolEntityShapes { eolEntityNoShape = 0, eolEntityCircle = 1, eolEntityRect = 2 }
enum  eolEntityDrawModes {
  eolEntityDrawBounds = 0, eolEntityDrawWireframe = 1, eolEntityDrawMesh = 2, eolEntityDrawTextured = 3,
  eolEntityDrawLighting = 4, eolEntityDrawShaded = 5
}
enum  eolEntityClipLayers { eolEntityClipLevel = 1 }

Functions

void eol_entity_config ()
 configure entity system from file or defaults
void eol_entity_init ()
 sets up entity system based on defaults
void eol_entity_clear ()
 deleted loaded entity data resetting system back to startup
eolBool eol_entity_initialized ()
 returns initialization status of entity system
void eol_entity_free (eolEntity **ent)
 Frees the entity passed. Sets pointer to NULL.
eolEntity * eol_entity_new ()
 Get a newly allocated freshly initialized entity.
void eol_entity_presync_all ()
 sync entity states with the collision space. Update desired forces, add and remove entities from the space. delete entities marked for death.
void eol_entity_postsync_all ()
 sync entity states from the collision space. Update positions, call touch functions.
void eol_entity_update_all ()
 calls all update functions for entities.
void eol_entity_think_all ()
 calls all think functions for entities if they need to think
void eol_entity_draw_all ()
 draws all entities in the current context.
void eol_entity_register_custom_delete (eolEntityCustomDelete delfunc)
 this function registers the custome delete function with the entity system note that for ALL entities, there can be only one custom delete. note that this must be called BEFORE the entity system is initialized
void eol_entity_register_custom_data_size (eolUint customSize)
 this function registers the size of the custom data segment note that this must be called BEFORE the entity system is initialized
void eol_entity_add_to_space (eolEntity *ent, cpSpace *space)
 Adds an entity to a physics space for physics calculations. automatically sets flags to enable physics for this entity. Entity must already have a defined body or this will fail.
void eol_entity_remove_from_space (eolEntity *ent)
 Removed the entity from the space that it is a part of.
void eol_entity_shape_make_circle (eolEntity *ent)
 sets up the internal body and shape for the entity so it can be added to a space as a circle uses ent->radius for making the radius of the circle. destroys previous shape and body data and must be re-added to the space.
void eol_entity_shape_make_rect (eolEntity *ent)
 sets up the internal body and shape for the entity so it can be added to a space as a rect uses ent->bounds for making the dimensions of the rect. destroys previous shape and body data and must be re-added to the space.
void eol_entity_set_collision_mask (eolEntity *ent, cpLayers collisionmask)
void eol_entity_add_to_collision_mask (eolEntity *ent, cpLayers collisionmask)
void eol_entity_remove_entity_from_collision_mask (eolEntity *ent, cpLayers collisionmask)
void eol_entity_add_actor (eolEntity *ent, eolActor *act)

this is the function prototype for a customData delete function a delete function must be provided if using customData the function must take a pointer to the custom data. It should be cast internally as the customData type.

Definition at line 42 of file eol_entity.h.

enum eolEntityStates

the Entity is the structure that defines anything that can act or or be acted upon in the game. This included everything from the player, to projectiles, monsters, npcs, doors, platforms and item pickups.<states for how the entity is treated by the entity system

Enumerator:
eolEntitySpawn 

spawned entities are running through their begining animations

eolEntityActive 

active entities are normal

eolEntityDying 

dying entities should be running through death animations and no longer clip

eolEntityDead 

dead entities are deleted after the end of the frame by the entity system

Definition at line 604 of file eol_entity.c.

void eol_entity_add_to_space ( eolEntity *  ent,
cpSpace *  space 
)

Adds an entity to a physics space for physics calculations. automatically sets flags to enable physics for this entity. Entity must already have a defined body or this will fail.

Parameters:
ent the entity to add
space the space to add the entity to

void eol_entity_register_custom_data_size ( eolUint  customSize  )

Definition at line 211 of file eol_entity.c.

void eol_entity_register_custom_delete ( eolEntityCustomDelete  delfunc  ) 

this function registers the custome delete function with the entity system note that for ALL entities, there can be only one custom delete. note that this must be called BEFORE the entity system is initialized

Parameters:
a pointer to the function that will be called when deleting custom data.

Definition at line 598 of file eol_entity.c.

void eol_entity_shape_make_circle ( eolEntity *  ent  ) 

sets up the internal body and shape for the entity so it can be added to a space as a circle uses ent->radius for making the radius of the circle. destroys previous shape and body data and must be re-added to the space.

Parameters:
ent the entity to become a circle

Definition at line 537 of file eol_entity.c.

void eol_entity_shape_make_rect ( eolEntity *  ent  ) 

sets up the internal body and shape for the entity so it can be added to a space as a rect uses ent->bounds for making the dimensions of the rect. destroys previous shape and body data and must be re-added to the space.

Parameters:
ent the entity to become a rect
